title: Level 1 Number Practice Test
description: Test your skills with numbers to 120, skip counting, and addition to 20!

questions.question: What number has 4 tens and 7 ones?
questions.explanation: 4 tens = 40 and 7 ones = 7. Together: $40 + 7 = 47$. The tens digit comes first, then the ones digit.

questions.question: What comes next when counting by 5s? 15, 20, 25, ___
questions.explanation: When counting by 5s, we add 5 each time. $25 + 5 = 30$. The pattern is: 15, 20, 25, 30, 35, ...

questions.question: What is $8 + 6$?
questions.explanation: Using the Make 10 strategy: $8 + 2 = 10$, then $10 + 4 = 14$. We split the 6 into $2 + 4$ to make a ten first.

questions.question: Which number is between 67 and 69?
questions.explanation: When counting: 67, 68, 69. The number 68 is between 67 and 69.

questions.question: What comes next when counting by 10s? 40, 50, 60, ___
questions.explanation: When counting by 10s, we add 10 each time. $60 + 10 = 70$. The pattern is: 40, 50, 60, 70, 80, ...

questions.question: What is $9 + 9$?
questions.explanation: This is a doubles fact: $9 + 9 = 18$. You can also use Make 10: $9 + 1 = 10$, then $10 + 8 = 18$.

questions.question: What is $5 + 3$?
questions.explanation: Start at 5 and count on 3: 6, 7, 8. So $5 + 3 = 8$.

questions.question: What number comes after 109 when counting forward?
questions.explanation: When counting forward from 109, the next number is 110. Just like 9 is followed by 10, 109 is followed by 110.

questions.question: Count by 2s: 2, 4, 6, 8, ___. What is the next number?
questions.explanation: When counting by 2s, add 2 each time. $8 + 2 = 10$. The full sequence is: 2, 4, 6, 8, 10.

questions.question: What is $7 + 6$?
questions.explanation: Using Make 10: $7 + 3 = 10$ and $10 + 3 = 13$. We split 6 into $3 + 3$ to make a ten first. So $7 + 6 = 13$.
